title: Problem with printing an embedded PDF-file in Edge Browser

comments.body: The on the internet solution not only allows you pay your costs. https://merrilllynchlogin.org/ The online Incentives Shopping center, you can get up to the factors each dollar.

Printing from an iframe in every browser is needed for a lot of company applications. So Microsoft develops into direction of only home applications and is going away from being a business software supplier. Next common systems for industrial applications will be linux or ubuntu.
Same issues can be found with CAD/CAM Software in Windows.
Does Microsoft really wants to loose this market.
This is important for corporate use !!! Get this fixed MS !!
In our company we use a OKI 7470 laser print which requires a user to fill user/password authentication form.

Over a year later and Microsoft has not fixed or addressed this complaint.  Sucks when people use Edge for their browser to run their business and reports cannot be printed.  Come on Microsoft, don't become a rotten APPLE :)
This is just sad, it totally breaks embedding pdf's in the browser what makes it even worse is that there is no javascript function to call to show the print dialog...
I have opened an issue here https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/7801755/

Here is a jsfiddle (https://jsfiddle.net/schallm/evdrkcrL/) showing the issue in Edge. How can the user print the pdf shown in the iframe. With Adobe Reader plugin in IE, Firefox's pdf viewer, and Chrome's pdf viewer, a toolbar shows as you mouse over the pdf to print it or the toolbar is shown depending on user settings.

You are doing something wrong. Reinstall your reader. However you will find, like I have, that you can't print multiple copies of the PDF. It only prints 1 even if you input 2 or more. This is only a problem with edge, as all of my programs print fine otherwise on Win10.
